name: Hard Pop Goes The Bible Quiz / Test | Thematic Fun | 20 Questions

questions.text: John Steinbeck wrote a book alluding to the exodus of the Israelites to a new home by sending the Joad family from Oklahoma to California in what novel?
questions.explanation:
Grapes of Wrath.

	In Steinbeck's 1939 novel, twelve members of the Joad family pack up what remains of their belongings in Oklahoma and head off to California for a better life. The twelve members of the Joad family represent the twelve tribes of Israel leaving  Egypt for a promised land.

questions.text: Denzel Washington played Eli in the 2010 movie "The Book of Eli". He was successful in getting a Bible into the hands of preservationists. In the end, what made Eli's feat so remarkable?
questions.explanation:
Eli was blind.

	Eli had the last copy of the Bible that he was trying to get to Alcatraz Island where it would be protected. Along the way he killed and maimed people in his pursuit. It was only when he reached Alcatraz Island that the people on the island realized he was blind. The Bible was in braille and Eli had memorized it.

questions.text: Who was the singer of "John Cougar, John Deere, John 3:16"?
questions.explanation:
Keith Urban.

	"John Cougar, John Deere, John 3:16" was Keith's first single on his ninth album. The song was written by Shane McAnally, Ross Copperman, and Josh Osborne in 2015. Keith sings that everything he needed to know in his life he learned from the singer John Cougar (Mellencamp), the machine company John Deere, and the Bible verse John 3:16.   The KJV of John 3:16 states, "For God so loved the world that He gave his only begotten Son that whosoever believeth in Him should not perish, but have everlasting life."

questions.text: Without saying the person's name, who was Sheldon referring to Leonard as when Sheldon gave him thirty pieces of silverware in the CBS series, "The Big Bang Theory"?
questions.explanation:
Judas.

	By giving Leonard thirty pieces of silverware, Sheldon was referring to Leonard as Judas in "The Large Hadron Collision" which aired in the United States on February 6, 2010. While Sheldon felt betrayed because Leonard was taking Penny to Switzerland instead of him, Judas was given thirty pieces of silver for betraying Jesus.

questions.text: In the CBS series, "God Friended Me", how was Miles Finer contacted by God?
questions.explanation:
Facebook.

	Miles was an atheist who had a podcast called "The Millennial Prophet". When he received a Facebook friend request from God, Miles began helping the people that God was sending him through the Facebook account. The show lasted from September 2018 to April 2020.

questions.text: As God, Morgan Freeman made Bruce Nolan (Jim Carrey) God in "Bruce Almighty" in 2003. In "Evan Almighty" in 2007, Morgan Freeman made Evan Baxter (Steve Carrell) what Biblical hero?
questions.explanation:
Noah.

	Evan Baxter prays that he would be able to change the world as a congressman in Virginia. One morning, Evan learns he has been tasked with building an ark after pairs of animals begin showing up, gopher wood is delivered to his house, and several lots are bought in his name giving him space to build the ark. After Evan changes the world as he prayed for, God lifts the changes that were made and Evan and his family return to their life, closer than before.

questions.text: In the series finale of "Seinfeld", what law were Jerry, Elaine, George, and Kramer arrested for breaking in Latham, Massachusetts?
questions.explanation:
Good Samaritan law.

	After becoming stranded in Latham, Massachusetts while the NBC plane is being fixed, Jerry Seinfeld and his friends witness a man being carjacked and don't help him. A Massachusetts police officer arrests them for violating the city's article 223-7 (Good Samaritan law). During the trial, former cast members that have been involved with Jerry and his gang return to air their grievances. Jerry and the gang are imprisoned in Latham County prison for one year.

questions.text: Della Reese and Roma Downey starred in a CBS series as two angels tasked with helping people in their walks of life. What was the name of the show?
questions.explanation:
Touched By An Angel.

	Della Reese played head angel, Tess, while Roma Downey played ingénue, Monica. Together the two of them played special roles in the lives of people while helping them navigate through difficult times. Airing from 1994 to 2003, "Touched By An Angel" had a plethora of special guest stars.

questions.text: Just as Christians believe that God sent his Son to give the world hope, what comic book/movie character sent his son to Earth to save him and the world?
questions.explanation:
Jor-El.

	Jor-El was played, famously, by Marlon Brando in the 1978 "Superman" movie,  Russell Crowe in "The Man of Steel", Terence Stamp in "Smallville", and Angus McFayden in "Superman & Lois". Jor-El was a scientist on the planet Krypton in the Superman universe. He sent his son, Kal-El, to Earth after learning that Krypton was going to be destroyed.

questions.text: "The Millennium Prayer" performed by Cliff Richards contains the music from "Auld Lang Syne" but the lyrics are part of what Bible verse?
questions.explanation:
Lord's Prayer (Matthew 6:9-13).

	"The Millennium Prayer" performed by Cliff Richards raised one million pounds (1, 411,955 US dollars) for Children's Promise, a charity for children. Paul Fields arranged the song after watching the reading of the Lord's Prayer at the funeral of Princess Diana. When Cliff's record label wanted nothing to do with the song, Cliff shopped around until he found a home for it at Papillion records.

questions.text: Playstation 2 and Xbox issued a Biblical video game called "The Bible Game" focused on trivia from the Old and New Testament in the Bible.
questions.explanation:
False.

	"The Bible Game" is a video game with trivia based on just the Old Testament. The video game can be played in TV game show mode or challenge game mode. It was developed by Mass Media and published by Crave Entertainment. "The Bible Game" had a US release in October 2005. The reviews on the video game were lackluster.

questions.text: "Paradise Lost" was written by John Milton and centered on what Biblical couple?
questions.explanation:
Adam and Eve.

	John Milton wrote ten thousand lines of verse about Adam and Eve. It was written between 1656 and 1674. Milton's "Paradise Lost" focused on the temptation of Adam and Eve by Satan and was separated into ten books.

questions.text: What band sings "Get Out Of Your Way" with a Biblical reading by Kendrick Lamar at the end of the song?
questions.explanation:
U2.

	As "Get Out Of Your Way" ends, Kendrick Lamar does a recitation of his own version of the Beatitudes from Matthew 5:3-11 as a segue into the next U2 song. The song was released in December 2017 and was written as advice for Bono's daughters. Kendrick's appearance in the song was in return for U2 singing with Lamar on his song, "XXX".

questions.text: John Steinbeck wrote a novel about two brothers named Cal and Aron Trask who resembled Cain and Abel. What was the name of the novel that was taken from a line in the Bible?
questions.explanation:
East of Eden.

	"East of Eden" came from the KJV of Genesis 4:16. After Cal and Aron had a huge fight, Aron left for the Army. When their father, Adam, asked Cal where Aron was, Cal responded with, "Am I my brother's keeper?". While Aron was in the Army, Cal stayed home and took care of their ailing father. "East of Eden" was published in 1952.

questions.text: "The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe" was the first in a series of juvenile books by C.S. Lewis. In it, a lion took a human's place and was killed only to be discovered alive three days later. What was the lion's name?
questions.explanation:
Aslan.

	C.S. Lewis wrote "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" as a way for young people to understand the resurrection of Jesus Christ. Aslan represents Christ and His dying on the cross for humanity's sins when Aslan dies in place of Edmund. "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" was published in 1950.

questions.text: "Catechumen" is a Biblical video game based in what Italian city?
questions.explanation:
Rome.

	"Catechumen" is a one-player video game that delves into the catacombs of Rome. The video game was released in 2000 for Microsoft Windows. The player must battle eighteen levels worth of demons to rescue his mentor. The game has been won when Satan is sent back to hell and the mentor has been rescued.

questions.text: In 2006, the first of which video game based on the teachings of Revelation was released?
questions.explanation:
Left Behind.

	The video game series "Left Behind" had four video games released: "Eternal Forces" (2006), "Tribulation Forces" (2007), "Rise of the Antichrist" (2010), and "World at War" (2011). The video game series was released for Microsoft Windows beginning in 2006. It was developed by Media Entertainment and based on the "Left Behind" series of books.Each video game can have up to eight players in one game. The players battle the Global Community Peacekeepers. If a player kills too many people in the game, the player's spirit level will drop causing the player to lose the game. The video game is based on converting people in the Global Community Peacekeepers and not killing them.

questions.text: In Elvis Presley's "Hard Headed Woman", what Biblical woman was NOT mentioned in the lyrics of the song?
questions.explanation:
Hannah.

	Claude Demetrius wrote the lyrics to the song. "Hard Headed Woman" is less than two minutes long and became a number one hit for Elvis Presley in the United States. The United Kingdom banned the song because the British Broadcasting Channel believed it wasn't a wholesome song to play.

questions.text: Who played the devil in the 1997 movie, "The Devil's Advocate"?
questions.explanation:
Al Pacino.

	When Kevin Lomax (Keanu Reeves) is hired by John Milton at a popular firm in New York City, he and his wife Mary Ann (Charlize Theron) move to New York City. When Mary Ann starts behaving erratically and soon commits suicide, Kevin realizes that John Milton is not who he pretends to be and learns that Milton is the devil. When Kevin commits suicide to keep from being Milton's puppet, Milton restarts Kevin's life and goes after Kevin once more with another deadly sin.

questions.text: Anita Diamant's "The Red Tent" is told from the viewpoint of what Biblical sister?
questions.explanation:
Dinah.

	The only daughter of Jacob tells the story of her family's life because she realizes she is the only daughter to carry on the story. Dinah refers to the red tent as the place she and her mothers go during their menstrual cycles. "The Red Tent" was published in 1997.
